Red, you actually can.  You just have to burn it to a 50gb (dual layer) blu ray.  The Wii will only read Xbox 360 games if they're burned JUST like that.  You also have to burn it at 1x speed, to be safe.

"4 - The Xbox 360 does not have an install and does require disc swapping during play.

"5 - Even though there is a disc swap, it occurs at a carefully planned place in the game (that does not interfere with gameplay) and is done once. You do not swap back and forth. 1 swap and then done.

I've read through all the comments here and I can't find answers about the disc swap. First disc works fine, but when the game asks for disc 2 and I insert it.. nothing happens, except an Xbox popup asking again for disc 2.
Also in the Xbox dashboard it says "open tray" when disc 2 is in, is this normal or am I supposed to be able to start the game with disc 2 also, or is it atleast supposed to be recocnized as Mass Effect 2; disc 2?

I don't use activate iso, I use 360WavesPatcher, which has worked until now. I patch all isos to wave 2 since I have iXtreme 1.5. I patched disc 2 to wave 2 also. So I shouldn't need the activate iso disc, but patching to wave 2 didn't seem to work in this case.

Does anyone know what to do with the disc swap?

Disc 1 was burned with ImgBurn at 2.0X or 2.4X (can't remember which speed I used) using a Maxell dvd+r dl. I ran out of discs in between so disc 2 was burned at 2.0X into a Verbatim dvd+r dl.. this shouldn't matter, right?

For the people having trouble burning this game, I wont be able to help much, but I can confirm that disc 1 works. Check the iso with abgx360, I recall abgx360 did some auto fixing on the isos when I ran them through. Use ImgBurn and try 2.0X and 2.4X speeds, Verbatim is propably the best media for Xbox 360, Maxell has also worked for me, though not as reliably. Make sure you use DVD+R DL discs. And maybe you could also try 360WavesPatcher instead of activate iso, if your Xbox can't read the discs. 360WavesPatcher should be used only after checking the isos in abgx360.

Thanks for the uploader and seeders!
